conclusion: Determine how objects A, B, C, and D change when the light source moves to the right, directly above the objects.
Light source is moving directly above the objects.
Objects will be illuminated by the light source.
Size and position of the objects will not change.
Light source will cast shadows on the ground, which will change in size and shape.
Object A is a small object that appears to be floating in the air.
When the light source is directly above Object A, its shadow will be cast on the ground and change in size and shape.
Object B is a large object that appears to be a device or machine.
When the light source is directly above Object B, its shadow will be cast on the ground and change in size and shape.
Object C is a small object that appears to be floating in the air.
When the light source is directly above Object C, its shadow will be cast on the ground and change in size and shape.
Object D is a small object that appears to be floating in the air.
When the light source is directly above Object D, its shadow will be cast on the ground and change in size and shape.
Objects A, B, C, and D will remain the same in size and position when the light source moves to the right, directly above the objects.
The light source will cast shadows on the ground, which will change in size and shape.
